Triggering Event: In the quiet of his study, he opened the bottom desk drawer, pushing aside yellowed medical texts to reveal a faded photograph. A younger him, wife smiling beside him at their daughter's graduation. He traced her face, regret heavy in his chest. He'd been too consumed by work then, missed so much. Today, she'd called about her motherhood struggles, echoes of his past failures ringing clear. He put the photo away, closing the drawer with a soft click, wishing he could do the same on his past.

She seemed upset when he suggested they adopt, but now she was telling him that she wasn't interested in having children at all. She said she had always wanted kids, but after seeing how hard it was for some friends who adopted, she decided she didn't want to go through that. The memory of his father, who had never wanted kids anyway, made him feel even worse. He told himself that she shouldn't expect anything from him, especially since he hadn't been there for her during her pregnancy.
